alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Oktibbeha (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 4:32AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Oktibbeha, southeastern Clay and central Lowndes Counties through 515 AM CDT... At 432 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Starkville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Tibbee and Bent Oak around 445 AM CDT. Columbus and Waverly around 455 AM CDT. Columbus AFB and Kolola Springs around 500 AM CDT. Steens around 505 AM CDT. Caledonia around 510 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Artesia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northeastern Mississippi.
